summary: This document is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, dated August 9, 2019, requesting a last-minute addition to a search warrant application for Jeffrey Epstein's property. The addition is based on an interview with a contractor who reported seeing photographs of nude or partially nude young girls at Epstein's residence between 1999 and 2006.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the search warrant; a contractor performed work for him at the premises to be searched.

persons.name: Individual-2
persons.context: A contractor who worked for Jeffrey Epstein at the subject premises from approximately 1999 to 2005/2006 and reported observing photographs of nude or partially nude young girls there.

persons.name: Judge Miller
persons.context: The judge reviewing the search warrant application to which this email pertains.

connections.description: Individual-2 performed work as a contractor for Jeffrey Epstein at the subject premises.

events.title: Contractor Observations at Epstein Residence
events.description: Individual-2, while working as a contractor at Jeffrey Epstein's premises, observed photographs of what appeared to be nude or partially nude young girls in several locations throughout the main residence.

events.title: Law Enforcement Interview of Contractor
events.description: In or about August 2019, law enforcement officers interviewed Individual-2, who provided information about photographs seen at Epstein's residence.

events.title: Search Warrant Amendment Request
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails to request adding a paragraph to a search warrant application based on new information obtained from interviewing a contractor.

locations: Subject Premises (Jeffrey Epstein's main residence, location unspecified)
New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York office)
keyFacts: A contractor (Individual-2) who worked for Jeffrey Epstein from approximately 1999 to 2005/2006 reported seeing photographs of nude or partially nude young girls in Epstein's main residence.
The contractor estimated that two of the girls in the photographs appeared to be approximately 15 or 16 years old and were topless.
This information was obtained by law enforcement in August 2019 and was being used to amend a search warrant application for Epstein's property.
The search warrant application was under review by Judge Miller at the time of this email.
